Ain't Got No Satisfaction

Posted on 07/09/2011 by David Turner

In the world of web technology moves at a mile a minute. What is cutting edge today, is old stuff tomorrow. What is current now will be outdated in the not too distant future.

This means that it is difficult to keep using cutting edge stuff on a project. What starts out using cutting edge stuff ends up being standard by launch, it's expected.

Perfection Remains Elusive

In a recent article Rick Monro talks about how perfection remains elusive. This post is of a similar vein, but looks more at what drives people (OK, drives me) to enjoy both developing & designing for the web so much.
